conversations.content: ...Hmm? I wonder who that is? Does she have business here?
E-excuse me!
Is this the castle of His Highness Prince Euden?
You're currently addressing him.
Really?! Oh gosh, I had no idea. I'm so sorry I didn't notice!
Please, don't worry about it. So, what can I help you with?
Well, I actually wanted to ask a favor.
I...I want you to hire me as a maid! Er, please.
I'll pour my soul into any task you give me!
I won't complain at all, and you won't need to pay me! ...Well, not at first, at least. Eventually I'll need something so I don't starve to death in a ditch somewhere.
Well, this is unexpected.
Personally, I'd be happy to have more help with the housework, but it's your call, Euden.
It's true that we have only a few people tackling a lot of work right now...
All right. You're hired.
R-really?!
Thank you so much! It's an honor to be  part of the team!
I know you've only just arrived, but might I ask you to help prepare lunch?
Of course!
Now that you've been good enough to hire me, I won't let you down!
AAAAH! THE STOVE LIT MY SKIRT ON FIRE!
I need to put it out! Water! Waaaaater!
Okay, I've taken care of that little prob— AAAAAH! THE POT OF FOOD IS ON FIRE!
Hurry, before the castle burns down! Water! Waaaaater!
Erm, Melody? There's oil in that pot, so putting water on it is just going to—
AAAAAAAAAAAH! IT'S GETTING BIGGER!
WHY IS THIS HAPPENING?!
Oh for heaven's sake. Move.
The best thing to do in these situations is put a wet cloth over the pot.
...It disappeared! You're amazing, Cleo!
Did you come here to help in this castle, or to destroy it?
You are unfit to be a maid on even the most fundamental of levels.
Have you EVER done this before?
I'm... I'm actually... Um...
...I'm still in training.
I've served as a trainee maid at loads of  different mansions. ...For, um, the past eight years, actually.
But I've never been able to graduate up to a full-blown maid because of... Well, the fires, for one.
I see. Well, you're fired.
No! Oh, please don't fire me, Cleo! I promise it will NEVER happen again!
If you haven't been able to succeed in  eight years, you aren't magically going to start doing so now.
Maybe she hasn't had the right teacher yet. I'm sure she'll be able to do it if you take the time to show her the ropes, Cleo.
Firing someone is easy, but it won't solve the fundamental problem.
Oh, very well. I'll teach her all there is to know about housework.
Th-thank you so much!
From this point on, I'm going to be perfect! I'll show you how a real mai— GAAAAH! *crash* *smash* *tinkle*
How does a person manage to fall into an entire cabinet of dishes?
*sigh* Give me strength, Goddess...
Hmm? What are you doing, Melody?
Oh! Good morning, Your Highness!
I just finished hanging up the laundry.
Melody? Where is the laundry I asked you to take care of?
The laundry? I just finished hanging it all...up...to...dry?
AAAAAH! THE WIND IS BLOWING IT AWAY!
...Melody? I want you to listen to me very closely.
That was several days' worth of clothes. If you don't get them back, we're all going to be wandering around naked tomorrow. ...Even Ranzal.
Eeep! I'm so sorry! I'll go find them right now!
...Please let me fire her.
She really seems to be trying her best. Let's give it a bit more time.
Well, I suppose she's a hard worker in...some respects.
And no matter how angry I get,  she never lets it get her down.
Umm...Cleo? There's, um... Er...
...A bird stole all the laundry.
Fired.
Surely you MUST agree with me now. We hired her thinking she would decrease my workload, but she's done the opposite.
Here's an idea: Why don't you give her a test of some kind?
Give her a task. Something basic. If she can do it, she stays.
It can't make that much extra work for you if it's something simple, right?
I feel like this is going to finish her off, but...very well.
Anything to stop her from interfering with the laundry again.
...You want me to make a cup of tea that satisfies Prince Euden?
That's right. If you can do that, I won't fire you.
Really?! Th-then I'll do my best!
Okay! First I need to light the stove and boil some water. That means I need matches, whiiich...aaaare...riiiight...
You might want to pay a little more attention while you're searching.
The container with all the tea leaves has got caught on your sleev— Oh dear.
AAAAAH! I SPILLED TEA EVERYWHERE!
Oh my gosh, I am SO sorry, Cleo. I'll just get another bag of tea leaves.
Melody, that bag contains flour. The tea leaves are over—
AAAH! NOW THERE'S FLOUR EVERYWHERE!
*cough* *hack* *wheeze* D-don't worry! I'll clean this up right away...
STOP! Don't...touch...anything. I'll do it. You just focus on making the tea.
I'm so, so, SO sorry...
Right! Okay, Melody, you can do this. First, I need to light the stove...
Light the stove...
Wait, isn't airborne flour flammabl—
AAAAAH! THE FLOUR EXPLODED!
How is this even possible?! All I wanted to do was make tea!
I have the exact same question.
...We HAVE to get rid of this woman, Euden.
I hear what you're saying, but I also think you may be overlooking her strong points.
No matter how many times you get angry with her, she always stays positive and cheerful, right?
Everyone tends to get a bit gloomy after we've been fighting for a while, so I think such cheer is important for morale.
Even if her housekeeping abilities are... a little lacking.
She lacks housekeeping skills in the same way I lack a second head.
...But this is your castle. If you want me to give her more time, I will do so.
*sniff* You're both so good to me...
This time, I won't let you down!
Grrrragh!
...Dammit, I missed one. Watch out— it's comin' yer way!
What? It is? AAAAAAAH!
Melody! Run!
D-d-d-don't come this way, or I'll... Hiii-YA!
...The heck? She took it out in one blow!
Whew! I managed to beat it. *sniff* That was terrifying...
Damn. A few fiends are gonna be nothin' if that's how ya fight.
Where'd ya even learn to handle a blade like that?
I once served a swordsman who taught me a few of the basics.
I don't seem to have any talent for being a maid, but I apparently do as a swordsman. Er, or a swordswoman, I guess.
Yer tellin' me.
What made him wanna teach his maid how to fight in the first place, though?
He seemed to find it something of a lark.
I joined him for daily sparring matches and refined my skills, not really thinking much of it...
But before I knew it, I was stronger than he was.
Whoa. That's pretty damn impressive. ...Bet he wasn't happy about it, though.
No, he wasn't.
One day, I defeated him in a battle, and he got so mad he fired me on the spot.
Not that I can blame him... It must have felt terrible for a real swordsman to be beaten by...you know. A MAID.
I'm more concerned about how hard it was for you.
That's kind of you to say. Still, I'm starting to think that learning to fight wasn't entirely a bad thing.
Because it means I might be able to be of some use to all of you.
I mean, I'd still prefer to be a maid, of course...
But until that happens, maybe I can use my swordsmanship to make up for all the other trouble I've caused.
So please don't fire me!
Er, I wasn't planning to. But if I can ask, why are you so determined to be a maid?
With that kind of skill with a blade, surely there's other lines of work—
No. It's maid or nothing for me.
Being a maid is more than just a job.
It's a way to connect with others!
I feel like if I'm looking after other people, I'll eventually become like family to them, which is exactly what I want.
That's something that's only possible if  I'm a maid.
...I think I understand.
Keep up the hard work, then!
I will, Your Highness!
I won't let you down!
She ain't one for takin' the easy road, eh?
I'd be tryin' to become a mercenary or somethin' if I was her.
Hmm... I wonder if there's some way she can use those skills AS a maid...
Umm, so how is the tea that I made for the two of you?
I didn't do anything seriously wrong, did I?
Well, it's... Um... *cough*
You mixed up the salt and sugar.
Oh, I'd never do that! Let me taste tha—
PLLLLBBBBBBTTTT! UGH! SALTY!
I can take this no longer.
You, Melody, are fired. Fired! F-I-R-E-D! Begone from this castle at once!
*sniff*
Cleo, that's hardly necessary.
Please be quiet, Your Highness.
...Melody. Since you're still standing there and clearly in no hurry to leave, I have a final task for you.
You can prepare the ingredients we need for tonight's dinner.
Just use your sword. Don't bother getting  the kitchen knife out, because you'll probably cut your toe off with it.
Don't think this is going to change your fate, though.
No matter how good a job you do, you're still fired.
*sniff* All right...
After all the trouble I've caused you, this is the least I can do.
I'll start with the vegetables...
Whoa. They're all the exact same size...
Next, I want you to fillet these fish into the shape of this castle—INCLUDING the moat and a working drawbridge.
Oh, and no matter how skillfully or quickly you do it, you're still fired, so there's no need to try very hard.
A-all right... Here!
She did that so quickly I barely saw it happen... And the drawbridge WORKS!
How did she suddenly get so good at this?!
...So I was right after all.
You expend all your mental energy trying not to fail, which is causing you to do precisely that.
And yet, if you do something thinking there are no consequences for failure and therefore don't worry about it, you perform far better.
Um... W-well, now you mention it...
I guess that's how I approached my sword practice, and I got good at that quickly.
So that's why you told her she was fired? To prove a point?
Basically, yes.
I'm sorry for being so cold toward you recently, Melody.
I am rescinding your firing.
And I'm promoting you from trainee to a full-fledged maid.
What? R-really?!
Absolutely. That fish drawbridge is absurd. There's no way I could do that myself.
So long as you stay relaxed, I'm certain you'll make a first-rate maid.
And then I won't have to fire you.
I'm really happy for you, Melody. Congratulations!
I...I can't believe this...
*sniff* Waaaaaaaaah!
Er, why are you crying?
Because I'm so happy! *sniff*
I've been a trainee for eight YEARS. I've been fired over and over and OVER.
But I've finally, FINALLY done it...
*sniff* *sniff*
Cleo... Your Highness...
Thank you so muuuuch!

title: Can I Really Become a Maid?

conversations.content: Oh! Good morning, master!
Er...master?
Of course! Now that I'm officially your maid, it's only right for me to refer to you as master.
This might take a while to get used to.
Hee hee! I'm pleased to serve you, master!
I understand that you're happy about  achieving your dream, Melody...
But if you let yourself get too carried away, you're going to mess something up again.
Oh! Cleo!
Yes, I suppose you're right. I need to stay focused.
No one can blame you, though. I mean,  you've wanted this chance for years.
It's no surprise you'd be happy about it.
Well, yes, I'm certainly happy about  becoming a real maid...
But there's something I'm even happier about than that.
Oh? What's that?
Being able to become a real maid HERE.
I've been away from my family trying to become a maid ever since I was 12.
I don't have many family memories, and I've always longed to belong to a really close one.
Everyone in this castle is so close; it's like they're all one big family.
So while I'm here, I feel like I'm part of a family, too—and that makes me happy.
So I'm glad not just to be a maid, but a maid HERE.
Well, welcome to the family, Melody!
Indeed, please think of all of us as family.
Th-thank you. Both of you.
This is the happiest moment of my lif—
...Huh? That sounded like an explosion from the kitchen!
AAAAAAH! I LEFT THE STOVE ON!
I should have known it was your fault...
Er, but what exactly did you leave on the stove that would cause it to explode?
Well... Um... Actually, I can't remember. What DID I put on there?
Well, let's go sort this mess out.
I'm so sorry for causing trouble again.
Honestly...
Perhaps I would have been better off firing you after all.
Noooo! P-please! Anything but that!
Ha ha ha!
It looks like you've still got plenty of training on the horizon if you want to be a first-rate maid.
